alert.note: Alert for West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 19 at 2:32AM MDT until April 19 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ..RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 10 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Critical fire weather conditions continue today through Thursday due to strong southwest to northwest winds, very low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. As many as 10 consecutive hours of single digit humidity values expected today over eastern New Mexico and the Middle Rio Grande Valley with poor overnight humidity recovery tonight over all but the Northeast Plains. Widespread critical fire weather conditions will persist Thursday with prolonged single digit humidity favoring areas along and south of I-40, but temperatures will be 5-15 degrees cooler than normal area wide. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from 10 AM to 10 PM MDT Today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
